Requirement_Text: The system shall provide lane keeping assistance only when the road surface classification equals 'paved' based on camera image analysis.
The system shall enable lane keeping assistance only when at least one lane marking has a detection confidence ≥ 0.75 on a 0–1 scale.
The system shall allow activation of lane keeping assistance only when vehicle speed is ≥ 60 km/h.
The system shall allow activation of lane keeping assistance only when vehicle speed is ≤ 190 km/h.
The system shall deactivate lane keeping assistance when vehicle speed remains below 55 km/h for more than 2.0 seconds.
The system shall transition to LDW-only mode if lane marking confidence remains below 0.50 for more than 1.0 second.
When deactivation occurs due to ODD limits, the system shall display 'Lane Keeping Assist unavailable' for at least 4 seconds.
The system shall sample camera-based lane detection at a minimum frequency of 30 Hz.
The system shall use steering angle sensor data with a minimum update rate of 100 Hz.
The system shall use yaw rate sensor data with a minimum update rate of 100 Hz.
The system shall not require GNSS availability for lane keeping support.
The driver shall activate or deactivate LKA using the steering wheel LKA button.
The system shall enter Standby when LKA is ON, speed ≥ 60 km/h, and lane markings have confidence ≥ 0.75.
The system shall activate steering assistance only after Standby for at least 0.5 seconds.
The system shall ramp in steering torque over a duration of 0.3–0.6 seconds to avoid abrupt steering.
The system shall automatically deactivate LKA when the driver presses the LKA OFF button.
The system shall deactivate LKA when the driver applies steering torque ≥ 5.0 N·m for > 1.0 second.
The system shall suspend steering support when a turn indicator is active and lateral acceleration exceeds 0.8 m/s².
The system shall resume steering support within 1.5 seconds after a lane change if lane markings are detected.
The system shall monitor steering wheel torque at a sampling rate of 100 Hz.
The system shall detect hands-off driving when driver-applied torque < 1.5 N·m for ≥ 7.0 seconds.
The system shall issue a first-level hands-off warning within 0.5 s after hands-off detection.
The first-level hands-off warning shall include a 75 ± 5 dB chime and a visual message 'Place hands on steering'.
The system shall issue an escalated hands-off warning if hands-on torque ≥ 1.5 N·m is not applied within 5.0 seconds after first-level warning.
The escalated warning shall include repeated chimes at 2 Hz and a flashing steering-wheel icon at 2 Hz.
The system shall deactivate LKA if no driver torque ≥ 1.5 N·m is detected for 15 seconds after the escalated warning begins.
The system shall cancel warnings within 0.5 seconds when driver torque ≥ 1.5 N·m is detected.
The system shall maintain lateral position error within ±0.30 m from lane center at 130 km/h on straight roads under nominal conditions.
The system shall limit lateral acceleration to ≤ 2.0 m/s² during cornering.
The system shall limit lateral jerk to ≤ 1.0 m/s³ during steering corrections.
The system shall limit applied steering torque to ≤ 3.0 N·m under normal lane centering operation.
The system shall initiate lane departure correction when predicted lateral offset reaches ≥ 0.25 m from lane boundary within 1.0 second.
The system shall differentiate solid, dashed, and road-edge markings and apply corrective torque only for solid and dashed lane lines.
The system shall read blind-spot occupancy inputs with a minimum update rate of 20 Hz.
The system shall treat a lane as occupied if any connected sensor reports occupancy = TRUE.
The system shall not apply steering torque that would cause the vehicle to cross into an occupied adjacent lane.
If occupancy data is unavailable for more than 0.5 seconds, the system shall ignore occupancy constraints and continue lane-based control.
The LDW haptic warning shall vibrate the steering wheel at 120–160 Hz for 0.4–0.6 seconds.
The system shall trigger LDW when predicted lane crossing time is ≤ 0.8 seconds and driver torque < 1.5 N·m.
LDW shall not activate when the corresponding turn indicator has been active for at least 0.3 seconds.
The system shall deactivate LKA within 0.2 seconds when the camera reports a critical failure state.
The system shall display 'LKA malfunction' for at least 6 seconds when a critical fault is detected.
The system shall store a diagnostic trouble code (DTC) within 0.1 seconds of detecting a camera or steering actuator fault.
The system shall inhibit steering support if the steering actuator reports torque tracking error > 1.0 N·m for more than 0.5 seconds.
The system shall record timestamped events for activation, deactivation, warnings, and faults with 1.0 ms resolution.
The system shall comply with UNECE R79 Class C lane keeping functionality requirements.
The system shall restrict user-configurable LDW sensitivity to two modes: Standard and Early.
The system shall disable LKA when Trailer Mode is active.
The system shall disable LKA when the tire diameter mismatch warning is active for more than 3 seconds.
The system shall provide OEM-approved descriptions, signal definitions, and state machine documentation suitable for AI system-knowledge training.
